function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Impromptu protocols and loose guidelines from national governments may lead to ineffective or insufficient protocols for using public spaces, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission due to lack of effective protocols for public space usage.","Mitigation":"Establish clear and detailed protocols for public space usage, in collaboration with public health authorities, with an emphasis on disease prevention measures.","Technologies":"Communication technologies for disseminating guidelines and monitoring compliance with protocols.","People":"Public space users, event organizers, city agencies, social organizations, and private entrepreneurs.","Owner":"City agencies, public health authorities, event organizers, and park managers."},{"Description":"Difficulty in adapting personnel to perform new tasks may lead to inadequate enforcement of disease prevention measures and inefficient management of public events.","Impact":"Inadequate enforcement of disease prevention measures and inefficient management of public events, leading to increased risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Provide training and support for personnel to adapt to new tasks, use temporary job programs, and establish clear guidelines for personnel responsibilities related to disease prevention.","Technologies":"Training and communication technologies for educating and supporting personnel in new tasks.","People":"Park personnel, city agencies, and event organizers.","Owner":"Park managers, city agencies, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Uncertainty about the duration of the measures may lead to inadequate long-term planning, affecting budget allocation and personnel tasks.","Impact":"Inefficient allocation of budget and personnel resources, leading to inadequate long-term management of public events and facilities.","Mitigation":"Develop flexible planning strategies, consider various scenarios for the duration of the measures, and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to address uncertainty.","Technologies":"Data analysis and scenario planning tools for predicting different outcomes and planning accordingly.","People":"Park managers, city agencies, and event organizers.","Owner":"Park managers, city agencies, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Decrease in funding for public agencies responsible for urban green spaces may result in insufficient resources to implement effective disease prevention measures and maintain the facilities.","Impact":"Inadequate implementation of disease prevention measures and maintenance of facilities, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Seek alternative funding sources, prioritize essential disease prevention measures, and collaborate with external stakeholders for resource allocation.","Technologies":"Crowdfunding platforms, budget management tools, and collaboration platforms for engaging external stakeholders.","People":"Park managers, city agencies, and external stakeholders.","Owner":"Park managers, city agencies, and external stakeholders."}]}
